name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: By keeping alive the spirit of Hick, and men like him who fearlessly commit to love, support and empower others, I think we can redefine what it means to be a man‚Äîfor the better.  In fact, I‚Äôm certain of it.   Happy Father's Day.  -John

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: But the truth is, there are just as many ways to be a man as there are to be a human being. It is always a choice.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs an understatement to say our country needs a new model of masculinity: one that is open, secure, unafraid to be emotional, to nurture, to love and to bring out the best in others.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: Even in his last days of illness, Hick showed so much strength, patience, and grace.   Decades later, when as Colorado‚Äôs Governor I guided our state through challenges horrifying and humbling‚Äîwildfires, flooding, shootings‚ÄîI thought of my father and rallied.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: As my Mom told me after Hick passed: ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt control what life throws at you, but you can control how you respond.‚Äù

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: For that reason, I always experience Father‚Äôs Day as a mix of emotions: an ache for the years unspent with Hick and the milestones he‚Äôll never know about, mingled with gratitude for the years I‚Äôll spend watching my son grow into the man he‚Äôs meant to be.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: There have definitely been times when having Hick by my side, a phone call or (nowadays) a FaceTime away, would have helped me do things better.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: I‚Äôve lived with Hick‚Äôs ghost my whole life: as a young man fumbling his way to adulthood, as a grown man transitioning careers and learning to navigate relationships, and‚Äîfor the last seventeen years‚Äîas a father myself.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: He loved fatherhood and life so much that what life had in store for him‚Äîand us‚Äîwas unusually cruel. By the time I was 7, cancer had hollowed out his body. Ten days after my 8th birthday, he died, leaving the family he had built to redefine itself again: this time, without him.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: He fostered curiosity and boldness in his children, taking one child out for dinner when she opened her eyes underwater, celebrating another for beating him in chess. He took endless joy in watching us grow.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: An engineer by trade, he loved taking things apart‚Äîoften on the living room rug, to my mom‚Äôs consternation‚Äîand putting them back together. He loved challenges, especially mental ones, and loved asking us to rise to them.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: He called us his tadpoles and his jewels. He loved introducing us to things he loved, like summer storms, fire engines, and The Wizard of Oz. He loved piling all of us in the car and just taking off, letting us navigate for him, embracing the adventure of getting lost together.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: Hick, who had lost his own father young, loved being a father‚Äîmaybe more than anything.   When my sister Deborah and I came along‚Äîhis two biological children‚Äîhe was Hick to us, too. He wanted us to feel like one family. And we did.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: From the very start, my father‚Äîwhom I still miss and yearn for every day‚Äîdefined fatherhood in his own way.  When he married my mother, she was a widow with two children. Rather than claim the name ‚ÄúDad,‚Äù he invited them to call him by his nickname, ‚ÄúHick‚Äù.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: For some, Father‚Äôs Day celebrates a relationship that continues to nourish and sustain. For others, it may be a day of pain or anger, perhaps at a father figure who has fallen short in some way.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: I try never to assume what Father‚Äôs Day means to people, because, if we‚Äôre honest, there are as many ways to be a father as there are to be a human being.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: Happy Father's Day to all the fathers and individuals who hold the responsibility of "father" in someone's life. In honor of Father's Day, I am sharing the story of my father -- Hick, as we called him.   Read the story here: https://medium.com/@johnhickenlooper/tadpoles-and-jewels-b2c1e8a0804d¬†‚Ä¶

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: When you‚Äôre running for president, it‚Äôs important to take time to reflect not just on where we‚Äôre going as a country, but where we‚Äôve been. Taking an honest look at our past is the only way to ensure that we don‚Äôt repeat it.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: Words cannot describe how breathtaking and heartbreaking the @mempeacejustice is.   The juxtaposition between the appallling injustices displayed and the name's tribute to peace and justice is a sobering reminder of our troubled past and our current responsibility. pic.twitter.com/zLuK8VDaUx

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: Our progress is measured by growing freedom of conscience, mutual respect and empathy towards others. We must find the time and temperament to listen, learn, and rebuild communities. It is urgent that we not lose faith in each other, and never stop building our temple of justice.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: And a great country should acknowledge its mistakes. Slavery is the nagging, unrelenting shame of America. We must own our past and acknowledge the shame, the sin, the injustice, and the ongoing consequences of enslaving an entire race of people.  And we must apologize.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: The US must end long-term solitary confinement;  We need an intense focus on transitioning out of incarceration and "ban the box" to end discrimination in housing and employment;  And as @JacksonLeeTX18 has proposed, we must convene a study on the best way to provide reparations.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: We must acknowledge that our criminal justice system is rooted in structural inequality, from slavery to government-sponsored discrimination in housing. From voting suppression to the war on drugs - all used to control people and limit their political power.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: Today, we face a crisis of faith and division. From the assaults on minorities, to the demonization of immigrants, and the rising tide of anti-semitism, and the terror and anxiety in our cities between police and neighbors, as MLK said, there is indeed a fierce urgency of now.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: We banned solitary confinement for inmates with mental illnesses, and ended the practice for longer than 15 days. With these reforms, in just a few years we dropped solitary confinement from 700 to 18 inmates.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: In CO, we made same day registration and mail-in ballots happen so that more people can vote. We legalized recreational marijuana and changed the focus of sentencing for drug use to rehabilitation and treatment. We granted clemency and commuted sentences for hundreds of people.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: We fought back on the damaging impact of racial bias in policing. We did it because our basic American compact says: People have the right to be safe, unafraid, and secure in their communities.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: We worked to reduce lethal force and police bias. We changed the way the police handled issues of misconduct, required all officers to go through crisis de-escalation training. We established the Office of Independent Monitor and a Civilian Oversight Commission for misconduct.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: During my time as Mayor, our strength was rooted in our diversity, reflecting the richness of Denver. More than 50% of my cabinet leadership were people of color and 60% were women. Our success had little to do with me, and everything to do with the people around me - my team.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: Just as we responded to the crisis of polio and the space race, we need to bring the private and public sector together to solve this climate crisis and save the only planet we have.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: @AOC and others have succeeded in galvanizing this country around climate change. Now that we have this support, it is imperative that we don‚Äôt abuse it. If climate action becomes synonymous with higher utility bills, rising taxes and lost jobs, we will have missed our shot.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: The federal government also must play a very active role through smart regulation and well-calibrated tax policy to shape the markets in which these firms compete.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: I am not suggesting that industry can do it alone. My version of a Green New Deal would also involve historic federal investments and incentives in electric storage, modern transmission and science to nurture the industries that will serve as the pillars of the clean economy.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: To achieve the kinds of innovations needed to tackle the climate crisis, government must not shun the private sector, but rather must work closely with industry and our nation‚Äôs great research universities to find solutions and scale them rapidly to meet our ambitions.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: Example: the resolution seeks a job guarantee, with full benefits, for every person in the United States. This and other provisions would produce a massive expansion of government that would likely be far too complex to execute effectively in the urgent time frame we are facing.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: In addition to technological barriers, the AOC-Markey resolution sets the Green New Deal up for failure by shifting away from private sector decision making and entirely towards government - including several provisions with little connection to reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: The resolution sets unachievable goals. We do not yet have the technology needed to reach ‚Äúnet-zero greenhouse gas emissions‚Äù in 10 years. That‚Äôs why many wind and solar companies don‚Äôt support it: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-greennewdeal-companies/solar-and-wind-firms-call-the-green-new-deal-too-extreme-idUSKCN1R212S¬†‚Ä¶

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: Some versions of the Green New Deal, such as the resolution from AOC and Senator Markey that the Senate is set to vote on this week, express laudable aims, but also take an approach that limits our prospects for success.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: That is why I support the aims of the ‚ÄúGreen New Deal‚Äù -- the concept that we should launch multiple major federal initiatives to tackle climate change and reorient our economy around clean energy. But given the stakes, it is also imperative we approach it correctly.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: @realdonaldtrump withdrew our country from the Paris Climate Accords. He is expanding drilling on public lands. He is forfeiting our country‚Äôs leadership, changing our national symbol from the eagle to an ostrich, burying our head in the sand in the face of this global threat.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: Climate change is a defining challenge of our time, and yet @realDonaldTrump taking us in the wrong direction.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: I've seen firsthand how gun violence shatters lives, and fundamentally changes our families and communities. We have to do more to prevent this senseless violence, to honor the victims and to support the people left behind. https://twitter.com/MiamiHerald/status/1109832695998230534¬†‚Ä¶

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: I also believe that we absolutely must achieve universal medical coverage, so that people can change jobs, change careers, or start new businesses like I did, without worrying whether they will have a gap in health insurance or access to a retirement savings vehicle.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: That's why a national plan for the American workforce would also increase the minimum wage to $15 per hour, rethink the employment system so that it supports people in the "gig" economy, and create paid family and medical leave.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: The traditional definition of a job is shifting in the future, but today, we need to make sure work really pays and that people have adequate benefits.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: A national strategy would mean a historic investment in skills training and apprenticeships. It would enlist labor unions, good corporate citizens, and civic organizations to join an effort that ensures people have the skills companies need to drive our economy forward.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: I am calling for a national strategy for the American workforce. America only works when the economy works for everyone, especially for the nearly 70% of Americans who will not graduate with a four year college degree.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: Today, new jobs are disproportionately low-wage and low-skill. They are less secure and pay less than before. In our "hour glass" economy, we have large swaths stuck at the bottom, a hollowed out middle, and a top growing with sky-high incomes and wealth.

name: John Hickenlooper
tweet: It's time for a national plan for the American workforce that helps the 70% of people who will not graduate with a four year degree.   I'm calling for a historic effort to drive our 21st century economy forward - for everyone. tweet: No one person can heal the fractures in America today. But if enough of us accept the challenge, if we work hard enough, we can make the impossible, possible.   Together, we can turn this winter of division into a season of hope.
